title: Competitive Benchmarking and Market Share Dynamics in Urban Coffee Retail
abstract: Examination of competitive dynamics across 8 major US cities. Customers visiting multiple chains monthly ('multi-homers') represent 38% of market but contribute 61% of total category revenue. Quality differentiation sustains price premiums of 15-22% vs. value competitors.
key_findings: Store proximity within 0.5 miles reduces customer loyalty 31%
Brand switching correlates with new store openings (r=0.68)
methods: Market structure analysis, discrete choice modeling, spatial analysis
